> Night Shift rolls ahead of Scorponok at a steady speed, and keeps his veh=
icle mode just in case he may have to make a run for it. He knew that keepi=
ng up with four tires on two legs was next to near impossible, unless of co=
urse the robot chasing you had the same capabilities. Accidentally his tire=
s kick up some dust as they spin.
>
> "Whoops, sorry about that. Caught a s=
lippery spot. Hmm, time ta change the tires I think."
>
> He moves forward.=

>

As the dirt and such are kicked up, several of Scorponok's
auto-cannons=
 orient themselves on Nightshift's form, and although they
do not open fire=
, their tips glow for a moment before once again going
dark. It is obvious =
that it was only a last minute force of will that
stopped him from opening =
fire.

"Yes, I'm sure that it was." Scorponok said in highly sarcastic and
=
suspicious tones. He was about to say something else when a message
came in=
 from Hydras . . .

> Hydras send a message to Skorponock telling him that =
keep and eye in the visitor and discretly interrogate him, and send a secre=
t orders do Perceptor.

Scorponok sent a silent acknowledgement back to Hyd=
ras as he and
Nightshift were entering the throne room. The room was curren=
tly empty
as Hydras had not yet arrived.

Scorponok stopped and shifted for=
m, assuming his massive robot mode.
As he was once a city-former Scorponok =
still  maintained tremendous
size relative to most. Although still human he=
ight, he was near the
top end at nearly 8' tall, towering over your more av=
erage mechs.
Scorponok's armor was thick and powerful, and although it look=
ed
somewhat blocky he moved easily within it. Both of his hands currently
e=
nded in large pincer like claws, and even on his left arm was mounted
some =
sort of large pincer like clawed cannon mount. On his shoulders
and chest m=
any of the same cannon mounts that were on his scorpion
mode were still pre=
sent.

He looked down at Nightshift, his red optics glowing thoughtfully,
"=
Now, what was this information that you had for us? No Maximals can
over he=
ar us in here?"
